moves.2... Nf6: Black generally does better with Nc6.
moves.3. Qxe5+ Be7 4. Qf4 d5 5. d3 Bg4 6. h3 B: Ph5 traps black's white bishop.  Ph6 makes room for it.
moves.11. h5 Bg5:
Well played count threat.  This picks up white's black bishop.  Nice trade.

New note:  Sonata296 points out QxBg5 is even better--white gets a free bishop.
moves.13... Nxg4 14. Bxg4 Nc5 15. fxg5: Mm, I think I prefer PxBg6.  Black must then respond to QxPh7#.
moves.15... f5 16. hxg6 hxg6 17. Qh8+: I would not do this.  Black threatens the white bishop (PxBg4).  Pushing the king to Kf7 permits black to play Rh8, so white loses Rh1.
